intro: Comanthosphace stellipila, commonly known as the star-shaped liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the order Marchantiales. It is characterized by its thalloid structure, which is flat and leafy, and it lacks true roots, stems, and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporophytes. Comanthosphace stellipila plays a vital role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
